messages.title: Continuing to secure an even better future for Reading West
messages.content: Since first being elected in 2010, I have taken up issues on behalf of tens of thousands of residents. With local people, I have campaigned successfully to deliver government investment for local rail, road and flood defence projects and more standard class seats between Reading and Paddington. I supported parent groups to set up the Wren School and All Saints Junior School, delivering extra funding and new school places. And, with patient groups, I worked to maintain the hydrotherapy pool at the Royal Berkshire Hospital and am supporting improvements in our local NHS services.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Extra funding for the NHS: 50,000 more nurses and 50 million more GP appointments a year
20,000 more police and tougher sentencing for criminals. Will tackle unauthorised traveller camps.
An Australian-style points-based immigration system. Reaching Net Zero by 2050 with investment in clean energy solutions and green infrastructure to reduce carbon emissions and pollution.
Millions more invested in schools, hospitals, apprenticeships and infrastructure.
Reaching Net Zero by 2050 with investment in clean energy solutions and green infrastructure to reduce carbon emissions and pollution.
£2 billion for the biggest ever pothole-filling programme.

Investing billions for childcare, increasing funding per pupil in every school and providing free school meals for all infants. Enabling everyone to look forward to their future retirement with a tax regular benefit of at least £1.5 billion over every.

issues.brexitEurope: Ensuring that communities can reap the rewards of Brexit and finally get control over the laws, borders, money and trade deals of the United Kingdom.

quotes.text: Thank you for the help and support you offered my husband and I with the visa process. We are enjoying our family life together.

A vote for me in Reading West stops Jeremy Corbyn becoming Prime Minister.
Prevents him from implementing his reckless spending plans, which would hand an additional £2,400 bill to every hardworking taxpayer every year.
